com.msi.moble

Interface MotorolaApplication


  • public interface MotorolaApplication
    This interface provides methods to send vendor specific commands.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object readRemoteData(mobleAddress peer, int address, int count, boolean with_response)
      Requests remote data from the given destination address.
      java.lang.Object readRemoteData(mobleAddress peer, int address, int count, byte[] data, boolean with_response)
      Requests remote data from the given destination address.
      java.lang.Object setRemoteData(mobleAddress peer, int address, int count, byte[] data, boolean with_response)
      Sets remote data on the given destination address.

    • Method Detail

      • setRemoteData

        java.lang.Object setRemoteData(mobleAddress peer,
                               int address,
                               int count,
                               byte[] data,
                               boolean with_response)
        Sets remote data on the given destination address. User is responsible for serializing data into data buffer. Callback MotorolaApplicationCallback.onWriteLocalData(mobleAddress peer,mobleAddress peer, Object cookies, short offset, byte count, byte[] data) will be called on the remote device.
        Parameters:
        peer - destination address. May be set to mobleAddress.BROADCAST to broadcast data.
        address - starting address of data range in address space.
        count - number of data elements starting from address to be sent.
        data - data buffer.
        If count = 1 and with_response = true then maximum accepted data.length is 375.
        If count = 1 and with_response = false then maximum accepted data.length is 376.
        If count > 1 and with_response = true then maximum accepted data.length is 374.
        If count > 1 1 and with_response = false then maximum accepted data.length is 375.
        with_response - true if response is requested to the command, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        if with_response = true then command identifier is returned. It shall be used for matching in callback MotorolaApplicationCallback.onResponse(mobleAddress peer, Object cookies, byte status, byte[] data). If with_response = false then null is returned.

      • readRemoteData

        java.lang.Object readRemoteData(mobleAddress peer,
                                int address,
                                int count,
                                byte[] data,
                                boolean with_response)
        Requests remote data from the given destination address.
        Parameters:
        peer - destination address. May be set to mobleAddress.BROADCAST to broadcast data.
        address - starting address of data range in address space.
        count - number of data elements starting from address to be requested.
        with_response - true if response is requested to the command, false otherwise.
        data - data buffer.
        If count = 1 and with_response = true then maximum accepted data.length is 375.
        If count = 1 and with_response = false then maximum accepted data.length is 376.
        If count > 1 and with_response = true then maximum accepted data.length is 374.
        If count > 1 1 and with_response = false then maximum accepted data.length is 375.
        Returns:
        if with_response = true then command identifier is returned. It shall be used for matching in callback MotorolaApplicationCallback.onResponse(mobleAddress peer, Object cookies, byte status, byte[] data). If with_response = false then null is returned.

      • readRemoteData

        java.lang.Object readRemoteData(mobleAddress peer,
                                int address,
                                int count,
                                boolean with_response)
        Requests remote data from the given destination address.
        Parameters:
        peer - destination address. May be set to mobleAddress.BROADCAST to broadcast data.
        address - starting address of data range in address space.
        count - number of data elements starting from address to be requested.
        with_response - true if response is requested to the command, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        if with_response = true then command identifier is returned. It shall be used for matching in callback MotorolaApplicationCallback.onResponse(mobleAddress peer, Object cookies, byte status, byte[] data). If with_response = false then null is returned.
